intro: Stichorkis latibasis, commonly known as the broad-based stichorkis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features include a short, sturdy stem and a basal rosette of leaves that are often broad and lobed. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
